reviews.text:
This is very basic Zone 3 station without step free access. The staff are friendly when manned. Fast trains do not stop here and there are not too many seating places probably very few use this station. If you want step free access with coffee shop and eateries please use the nearby Richmond station in Zone 4.
PS: On clear days, from the station you can see upto three flights flying one behind other to land in Heathrow!

Many comments here are polite. This is the easily one of the shabbiest station I've seen in this country. Especially accessibility. Strange as I don't think the problem is that difficult to solve though it is left to what it is today.
This station definitely needs some work done. I really don't know how women with pushchair and disable with wheelchair ever access it.

A small station without much to offer.
Staff are friendly
Only accessible by climbing a footbridge and not wheelchair access.

Very much lacking in accessibility as there's so many steps required, especially if the barriers are down. There's easy to read information boards but no coffee shop and a real lack of seating on the platforms, or any coverage from the elements further down the platforms.

The station is very rarely manned.
